author: Special Correspondent
text:
V. Rajendran (right), Director, Research and Development, Centre for Nanoscience and Technology, KSR Group of Institutions, Tiruchengode, receiving the award from Union Minister for Science and Technology Harsh Vardhan at New Delhi.

V. Rajendran, Director, Research and Development, Centre for Nanoscience and Technology, KSR Group of Institutions, has received the national award instituted by the National Council for Science and Technology Communication, Department of Science and Technology, New Delhi.

He received the award from Union Minister for Science and Technology Harsh Vardhan at a function held in New Delhi, recently.

The award comprised a cheque for Rs. 1 lakh, memento and a citation.

Mr. Rajendran was selected for the national award for 2015 for his outstanding efforts in popularising science and technology among children. He has designed and used strategic methodologies like science exhibitions, recognition of best high school teachers and facilitating children to interact with Nobel laureates and distinguished scientists. Mr. Rajendran has been organising science exhibitions since 2003 to bring out the inherent science talent and skill even among students in rural schools. He had honoured best high school teachers who developed novel teaching aids, text books and new methods of teaching to promote talents of high school students.

He has also organised DST- sponsored INSPIRE camps for talented 11,500 Plus-One students from 1,835 schools from different parts of Tamil Nadu.

K. S. Rangasamy, Chairman, K. S. R. Group of Institutions, R. Srinivasan, Managing Trustee and Secretary, felicitated Mr. Rajendran.

He has been organising science exhibitions for school students since 2003
title: Award for taking science to children
